properties.titleEn: Introduction
properties.titleFr: Introduction

properties.titleEn: SDI funding is for short-term, indirect service projects that will focus on testing new approaches to delivering high-quality settlement services. It is not intended to fund direct settlement services.
properties.titleFr: SDI funding is for short-term, indirect service projects that will focus on testing new approaches to delivering high-quality settlement services. It is not intended to fund direct settlement services.

properties.titleEn: Does your project propose indirect settlement services or direct services only within a testing context?
properties.titleFr: Does your project propose indirect settlement services or direct services only within a testing context?

properties.titleEn: The project must undertake innovative approaches (a new approach or adaptation of an existing approach) and be informed by user-centred design principles that places clients and their needs at the center of the innovation’s focus, contribute to building strong evidence-based research, and respond to the problem statement.
properties.titleFr: The project must undertake innovative approaches (a new approach or adaptation of an existing approach) and be informed by user-centred design principles that places clients and their needs at the center of the innovation’s focus, contribute to building strong evidence-based research, and respond to the problem statement.

properties.titleEn: In your application, will you be able to demonstrate how you’ve conducted a strong assessment of gaps in existing policies, approaches or initiatives directed toward IRCC eligible clients?
properties.titleFr: In your application, will you be able to demonstrate how you’ve conducted a strong assessment of gaps in existing policies, approaches or initiatives directed toward IRCC eligible clients?

properties.titleEn: The following elements should be included in a full proposal to ensure a well-designed evaluation plan is produced:
properties.titleFr: The following elements should be included in a full proposal to ensure a well-designed evaluation plan is produced:

properties.descriptionEn: (1) A comprehensive plan to measure performance and track progress to achieve identified Settlement Program outcomes;
properties.descriptionFr: (1) A comprehensive plan to measure performance and track progress to achieve identified Settlement Program outcomes;

properties.descriptionEn: (2) Clear, measurable and meaningful performance indicators to assess impact;
properties.descriptionFr: (2) Clear, measurable and meaningful performance indicators to assess impact;

properties.descriptionEn: (3) An effective approach to establish baseline data on indicators;
properties.descriptionFr: (3) An effective approach to establish baseline data on indicators;

properties.descriptionEn: (4) Multiple lines of evidence to increase the reliability of data;
properties.descriptionFr: (4) Multiple lines of evidence to increase the reliability of data;

properties.titleEn: Can you clearly articulate how you possess the skills and experience to put forward a robust evaluation plan focussing on outcomes? Or, can you outline a comprehensive plan to ensure that a qualified third-party evaluator will deliver such a plan?
properties.titleFr: Can you clearly articulate how you possess the skills and experience to put forward a robust evaluation plan focussing on outcomes? Or, can you outline a comprehensive plan to ensure that a qualified third-party evaluator will deliver such a plan?

properties.titleEn: It is strongly encouraged that applicants collaborate with new and existing partners throughout the life of the project.
properties.titleFr: It is strongly encouraged that applicants collaborate with new and existing partners throughout the life of the project.
properties.descriptionEn: Potential applicants must define how they will engage key partners who will collaborate in a meaningful way to the successful of the project. This includes identifying existing partnerships, describing the nature of the partnerships, and the skills and experiences these partnerships will bring to the project.
properties.descriptionFr: Potential applicants must define how they will engage key partners who will collaborate in a meaningful way to the successful of the project. This includes identifying existing partnerships, describing the nature of the partnerships, and the skills and experiences these partnerships will bring to the project.

properties.titleEn: Have you identified relevant partners for your project, and can their contributions be clearly explained in detail and linked to the achievement of the projected outcomes?
properties.titleFr: Have you identified relevant partners for your project, and can their contributions be clearly explained in detail and linked to the achievement of the projected outcomes?

properties.titleEn: SDI has the goal of informing Settlement services to ultimately improve them in the medium to long term. As a result, reporting to IRCC for an SDI project may require reporting beyond the standard financial and activity reporting expected for the Settlement program.
properties.titleFr: SDI has the goal of informing Settlement services to ultimately improve them in the medium to long term. As a result, reporting to IRCC for an SDI project may require reporting beyond the standard financial and activity reporting expected for the Settlement program.

properties.titleEn: In 750 words or less, please describe the methodology(ies) that will be used to demonstrate how, and to what extent, service delivery and client outcomes have improved.
properties.titleFr: In 750 words or less, please describe the methodology(ies) that will be used to demonstrate how, and to what extent, service delivery and client outcomes have improved.
properties.descriptionEn: (Examples of methodologies that can be used are: Comparing a status quo (existing) service with a new service delivery approach; Comparing two substantively different service delivery approaches implemented at the same time to achieve the same outcomes; Comparing one service delivery approach with two distinct client populations to determine whether the intervention is more effective with specific populations; Applying randomized control trials. Other methodologies to address the problem/issue/gap may be considered where appropriate and where the project does not align with the above described methodologies.)
properties.descriptionFr: (Examples of methodologies that can be used are: Comparing a status quo (existing) service with a new service delivery approach; Comparing two substantively different service delivery approaches implemented at the same time to achieve the same outcomes; Comparing one service delivery approach with two distinct client populations to determine whether the intervention is more effective with specific populations; Applying randomized control trials. Other methodologies to address the problem/issue/gap may be considered where appropriate and where the project does not align with the above described methodologies.)
